meanings.definition: Capable of being compelled or forced to do something.
meanings.sent1: The witness was compellable to testify in court.
meanings.sent2: The contract clearly stated that both parties were compellable to fulfill their obligations.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat was compellable to take its medicine, much to its dismay.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were compellable to release their rain, drenching the parched earth below.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic force was so compellable that it pulled all nearby objects towards it.

meanings.definition: Able to be legally required or obligated to do something.
meanings.sent1: The employee's attendance was compellable by company policy.
meanings.sent2: The defendant was compellable to appear in court for the hearing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student found himself compellable to complete his homework before recess.
meanings.sent4: The melody was so compellable that it lingered in the listener's mind long after the song ended.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was so compellable that it drew everyone to the kitchen.
